pages.text: Ground nuggets are good at indicating veins, but you'll want something more accurate. Work or cast a prospector's pickaxe in order to start prospecting. It only takes 100 units of any tool metal, and they're all equally useful.$(br2) While ground nuggets are only 10 units of metal, ores can be $(thing)Poor, Normal, or Rich$() (15, 25, or 35 units)

Right click on the Earth to use the prospector's pick. It checks in a 25 block cube for ores, and reports back what it finds and in what concentration.$(br)$(thing)Note: The pick will never lie about the existence of an ore vein, but sometimes it will fail to detect a vein that is there. To combat this, just click another block nearby.

$(thing)Prospecting Method$()$(br2)1. Click with prospector's pick until traces of an ore are detected.$(br)2. Walk around until you detect a very large sample.$(br)3. Walk in one direction clicking until it no longer says 'very large sample'. Mark this spot.$(br)4. Go back to the middle and do the same thing in the other direction.$(br)5. The center of the two lines formed by your markings should be the vein's center.

pages.title: Support Beam
pages.text: The support beam is needed to keep caves and mineshafts from collapsing on you. Falling stone will destroy ore (and you) so it's important to use safe mining practices.

$(thing)Note: Only horizontal support beam blocks can support blocks$().$(br2)To construct a support structure, first right click with a support beam on the ground. A 3 high pillar should form. Make a second pillar, then right click on the side of one to connect them.$(br2)$(thing)Note: If a block falls onto a support beam, the entire structure may collapse.$()
Imagine the center of this structure was a single support beam.
pages.name: Support Visualization

pages.text: With a single horizontal support, 3 blocks vertically and 4 blocks in each direction are supported, as shown by the diagram. Be careful mining into unsupported areas, as this can cause a widespread collapse that will easily kill you!
